messages.text: G-743129 is your Google verification code. Don't share this code with anyone. If you did not request this code, ignore it.

options.text: This is a legitimate verification code
options.feedback: Correct! This is a legitimate verification code from Google. It follows their standard format, doesn't ask you to click any links, and clearly states to ignore it if you didn't request it.

options.text: Use the code if you just requested a verification code from Google
options.feedback: Perfect! If you initiated a sign-in or password reset, using the code is appropriate.

options.text: Ignore the code if you didn't request it
options.feedback: Excellent! If you didn't request a code, ignoring it is exactly what you should do, as the message advises.

options.text: Change your Google password immediately if you didn't request this code
options.feedback: Good thinking! If you received an unrequested verification code, someone might be trying to access your account, so changing your password is a prudent security measure.

options.text: Share the code with the person who needs it
options.feedback: Never share verification codes with anyone! The message explicitly warns against this. Sharing codes allows others to access your accounts.
